name: Kisaan  Triple Attack Liquid Insecticide | Organic Spray for Thrips, Mealybug
description:
About Product:




Katyayani Triple Attack is a biological insecticide containing a combination of Verticillium Lecanii, Beauveria Bassiana, and Metarhizium Anisopliae in liquid formulation.


It effectively controls a wide range of insect pests by germinating fungal spores on the surface of insects or larvae.


Works against sucking, chewing, and all types of pests in vegetables, cereals, millets, oilseeds, paddy, fruits, and plantation crops.


Eco-friendly and suitable for organic farming and integrated pest management (IPM).




Technical Details:


Technical Content:
 Verticillium Lecanii + Beauveria Bassiana + Metarhizium Anisopliae


Mode of Entry:
 Contact Action


Mode of Action:




When applied, fungal spores attach to insect bodies and germinate under the right conditions (temperature and humidity).


These spores penetrate the insect's body, causing infection and leading to its death.


The fungus then grows outside the insect, covering it in a white or yellowish mold, releasing more spores to continue the cycle.




Dosage of Triple Attack






For Foliar Application:
 2 lit/ Acre.




For soil Application:
 2lit/ Acre




Key benefits of Triple Attack




Suitable for vegetables, cereals, millets, oilseeds, paddy, and fruits.


Effective for home gardens, kitchen gardens, nurseries, and organic farming.


Provides long-lasting pest control without harmful residues.


Causes fungal growth on pests (white bloom effect), ensuring effective bio-control.




Disclaimer:




Follow label instructions for correct usage.






Triple Attack Related
 
FAQs




Q. What is the best insecticide to use for thrips in chilli?


A. Triple attack is one most recommended product which is used against the thrips in chilli crops.


Q. Does Triple Attack insecticide work against the sucking pest?


A. Yes, Katyayani Triple Attack is effective against sucking pests such as aphids, whiteflies, scales, and jassids due to its mode of action where fungal spores penetrate and kill insects on contact.


Q. Can Triple attack product work more than chemical insecticide?


A. Triple attack is a bio-product which is widely used against the different types of pests, which works equal to chemical insecticide for plants.


Q. What is the best product used against the borers in paddy crops?


A. Triple attack is one the most recommended insecticide against the caterpillars in paddy crops.


Q. What is the dosage of a Triple attack liquid product?


A. The minimal dosage of Triple Attack liquid is around 5-10 ml per Liter of Water.


Q. What is the cost of a Triple Attack 1 liter bottle?


A. The price of Triple attack is around 525 rupees for a liter bottle.

Broad-Spectrum insecticide effective against multiple pests.

name: Kisaan  Chloda | Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC | Chemical insecticide
description:
Katyayani Chloda is a chemical insecticide containing Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% and Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% in a mixed formulation of Capsule Suspension and suspension concentrates. It effectively controls a wide range of insect pests through Systemic and Contact action by disrupting nerves and muscles of an insect and leads to Paralysis and causes death of an insect. This insecticide is suitable for agricultural use against pests such as borers, Jassid, stem fly, Thrips in many crops like Paddy, Brinjal, Soybean and chilli.


Target pests of Katyayani Chloda Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC


The target pests of Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC include Borer (Pod, Shoot, Fruit, stem in paddy), Bollworms, Hoppers, Jassids, Loopers, Moths, leafminers, Thrips and many other pests.


Target crops of Katyayani Chloda Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC


The target crops of Chlorantraniliprole 9.3 Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6 ZC includes Pigeon pea, Cotton, Brinjal, Okra, Paddy, Soybean, Cabbage, Groundnut, Black gram and many other horticultural crops.


Uses of Katyayani Chloda Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC




Effective against a wide range of insects, including beetles, caterpillars, leafhoppers, and whiteflies.


Chlorantraniliprole provides long-lasting protection against insects, even after rain or irrigation.


Lambda-cyhalothrin acts quickly to kill insects on contact.


Combination of two different modes of action helps to reduce the risk of insects developing resistance to the product.


Control all stages of the pest, including eggs and adults.




Mode of Action of Chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC


The mode of action of chlorantraniliprole 9.3% + Lambda Cyhalothrin 4.6% ZC is Systemic and Contact action




Chlorantraniliprole: It has a systemic mode of action, meaning it is absorbed by the plant and kills insects that feed on it. It disrupts the insect's muscle function, leads to Paralysis and causes death of an insect.


Lambda-cyhalothrin: It has a contact mode of action, meaning it kills insects on contact with the insecticide. It works by disrupting the insect's nervous system, leads to Paralysis and causes death of an insect.

name: Kisaan  Meta Power | Metarhizium Anisopliae | Liquid Bio Insecticide
description:
Katyayani Meta Power (Metarhizium Anisopliae) is a Bio Insecticide. It is a liquid formulation containing high concentrations of natural live Metarhizium Anisopliae fungus. When applied to soil or leaves, it comes into contact with insects and penetrates into the outer layer and causes death of insects. It is considered an eco-friendly alternative to chemical fungicides because it is safe for humans, animals, and the environment.


Target pests of Metarhizium Anisopliae Bio insecticide


The target pests of Metarhizium Anisopliae include weevils, Black vine weevil, Spittlebug, White grubs, Termites, Japanese beetle, Caterpillar, Semi loppers, Borers, Cutworm


Target crops of Metarhizium Anisopliae Bio insecticide


The target crops of Metarhizium Anisopliae includes Paddy, Brinjal, Chickpea, Potato, Tomato, Chilli, Okra, Coconut, Cotton, Maize, Wheat, Sugarcane, Groundnuts, Soybean, Coffee, Tea, Cocoa, Oil palm, Mango, Papaya, Citrus other agriculture and plantation crops.


Mode of Action of Metarhizium Anisopliae Bio insecticide


When spores of Metarhizium Anisopliae come into contact with an insect's body, they germinate and penetrate the insect's cuticle (the outer shell). Once inside the insect's body, the fungus grows and produces toxins that kill the insect. The dead insect's body becomes covered in a white mold, which is a sign of the fungus.


Dosage of Metarhizium Anisopliae Bio insecticide




For Domestic use: 5 - 10 ml per Liter


Soil Application: 1 - 2 liters per acre.

Safe for humans, pets, and beneficial insects


No harmful residues on crops


Can be used in organic farming


Effective against a broad spectrum of insects

name: Kisaan  Neem Oil 10,000 | Organic Insecticide
description:
Katyayani Neem Oil is a Organic Insecticide derived from the Neem tree, The active ingredient in neem oil is azadirachtin, which disrupts the growth, feeding, and reproduction of many insects. Neem oil 10000 ppm is considered a broad-spectrum insecticide, meaning that it is effective against a wide range of pests.


Target pests of Neem Oil 10,000

Aphids, whiteflies, thrips, jassids, spider mites

Leaf-eating caterpillars




Target crops of Neem Oil 10,000

Mode of action of Neem Oil 10,000




Repellent - Do not encourage pests to present on your crop. The neem oil makes it difficult for them to move and feed properly.


Feeding Disruption: The oil disrupts the insect's hormones and nervous system, making them lose their appetite and stop feeding on your plants.


Growth Regulator: Neem oil interferes with an insect's molting process, hindering their growth and development. This disrupts their life cycle and prevents them from reaching maturity and reproducing.


Egg-Laying Deterrent: Azadirachtin, the active ingredient in neem oil, acts as an anti-feedant and oviposition deterrent. This means it discourages insects from laying eggs on your plants, reducing future pest populations.




Dosage of Neem Oil 10,000


For Agriculture use: 5 ML / Litre of Water


Key benefits of Neem Oil 10,000




Effective against a wide range of pests, including aphids, whiteflies, thrips, bollworms, pod borers, and leaf-eating caterpillars.


Neem oil is a natural product


Neem oil is relatively safe for beneficial insects, such as ladybugs and honeybees, which can help to control pest populations naturally.


Neem oil also has repellent properties that can help to deter pests from feeding on plants.

Mode of Action


Nitrogen Fixation:




Azotobacter spp. enhances nitrogen uptake by fixing atmospheric nitrogen and converting it into forms usable by plants.


Produces plant growth hormones like IAA(indole-3-acetic acid)  and GA(gibberellic acid), as well as vitamins, to promote better uptake of nutrients such as NO₃, NH₄, H₂PO₄, K, and Fe.

Potassium Mobilizing Bacteria (KMB) release potassium from its fixed and unavailable forms in the soil, making it accessible to plants.

name: Kisaan  BAXIL | Bacillus supp 2% AS | Liquid Bio Fungicide
description:
Katyayani BAXIL (Bacillus supp 2% AS) is a Bio fungicide. It is a liquid formulation containing high concentrations of natural live Bacillus Subtilis bacteria. When applied to the soil, plant or seeds, the bacteria colonize the plant root zone and help to protect plants from a variety of fungal diseases. It is considered an eco-friendly alternative to chemical fungicides because it is safe for humans, animals, and the environment.


Target diseases of Bacillus Supp 2% AS


The target diseases of Bacillus supp 2% AS includes Down mildew, Powdery Mildew, Anthracnose and Leaf blight diseases. It controls all types of Seed, Soil and Air borne diseases.


Target crops of Bacillus Supp 2% AS


The target crops of Bacillus supp 2% AS includes the crops like Oil Seeds, Cotton, Tomato, Pea, Beans, Millet, Pulses, Onion, Garlic, Basil, Cucurbita, Mango, Grapes, Ginger, Citrus, Cereal, Corn, Apple, Pomegranate, Peach, Plum and many other crops.


Mode of Action of Bacillus Supp 2% AS


It works in a few different ways to suppress fungal growth:






Competition:
 Bacillus subtilis competes with pathogenic fungi for space and nutrients on the plant surface and in the soil.




Antibiotic production:
 Bacillus subtilis produces antifungal compounds that can inhibit the growth of fungal spores and hyphae.




Induced systemic resistance (ISR):
 Bacillus subtilis can trigger a plant's defense mechanisms, making it more resistant to fungal infection.




Dosage of Bacillus Supp 2% AS


Soil Application:
 Mix 1 - 2 liter of Bacillus Subtilis per acre with 200 kg of FYM/compost and broadcast in the field at the time of land preparation, sowing, and standing crops. Give light irrigation after application.


Foliar spray:
 Mix 5 - 10 ml of Bacillus Subtilis in 1L of water and spray to cover both sides of the leaves at the appearance of the very first incidence of the disease symptoms. Repeat at intervals of 7-10 days.


Important recommendation:
 2-3 applications are recommended at intervals of 7-10 days. Can be increased depending on the disease incidence.


Benefits of using Bacillus Supp 2% AS




A multifaceted mode of action against a range of fungal diseases


Produces lipopeptide antibiotics with fungicidal activity


Comprehensive solution for controlling seed, soil, and air-borne fungal diseases.


Eco-friendly alternatives to chemical fungicides


Mainly targets Downy Mildew disease




Bacillus Supp 2% AS Related FAQs


Q. What is the best Bio fungicide for Downy Mildew disease?


A. BAXIL (Bacillus Supp 2% AS) Bio fungicide is the recommended product that works against the Downy mildew disease.

A. Bacillus Subtilis Bio fungicide is the recommended product that works against the Blight disease in Tomato crop.

A. Application of Bacillus Subtilis Bio fungicide by foliar spray helps in getting rid of powdery mildew disease in Chilli crop.

A. Bacillus Subtilis Bio fungicide can be applied in many ways such as seed treated, Soil applied or through foliar spray.

name: Kisaan  Weed killer + Herbicide
description:
Katyayani Weed Killer Plus is a versatile, broad-spectrum herbicide designed to effectively manage unwanted weeds and vegetation in agricultural fields, landscaping, forestry, and aquatic environments. It targets essential plant growth enzymes, making it a reliable and efficient solution for maintaining weed-free landscapes and crop fields.


Mode of Action


Katyayani Weed Killer Plus works by targeting critical enzymes in plants responsible for their growth and metabolic processes. Upon application, it is absorbed by the foliage and transported to the plant’s growing points, disrupting physiological processes and leading to desiccation and death. It acts as a non-selective herbicide, targeting all vegetation it comes into contact with.




Key Features of Katyayani Weed Killer Plus






Broad-Spectrum Control: Targets a wide range of weeds and vegetation across multiple environments.


Versatile Use: Effective in agriculture, forestry, landscaping, and aquatic weed control.


Efficient Action: Works quickly on stubborn and thick vegetation.


Non-Selective Herbicide: Targets all vegetation, making it ideal for site preparation and clearing.


Eco-Friendly: Safe for controlled application when used as directed.


Cost-Effective: Reduces manual weeding efforts and boosts productivity.

A: The recommended dosage is 800 ml to 1 liter per acre, diluted in 200 liters of water.




Q3. How does Katyayani Weed Killer Plus work?




A: It disrupts vital plant enzymes, leading to desiccation and death, ensuring effective weed management.

A: No, it is a non-selective herbicide that targets all vegetation, including both weeds and desirable plants.

name: Kisaan  Lemar -Tembotrione 42% SC (34.4% w/w) 115ml  + Surfactant 400ml | Herbicide
description:
Katyayani Lemar

Tembotrione 34.4% SC
. It is specially formulated to effectively manage broadleaf and grassy weeds in maize crops, ensuring optimal crop growth and higher yields. Known for its fast-acting results and rainfastness, Katyayani Lemar is the ultimate solution for farmers seeking efficient and sustainable weed control.


Technical Name


Tembotrione 34.4% SC


Mode of Action of Katyayani Lemar (tembotrione 34.4 sc)


Katyayani Lemar inhibits the enzyme 
4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase (HPPD)
, crucial for carotenoid synthesis in weeds. This disruption leads to a depletion of protective pigments, causing chlorophyll bleaching and the eventual death of weeds. The formulation ensures rapid absorption and effectiveness, even under challenging conditions like rainfall.




Key Features of Katyayani Lemar (tembotrione 34.4 sc)






Selective Herbicide: Targets broadleaf and grassy weeds without harming maize crops.


Fast-Acting Formula: Visible weed control within few days.


Rainfast Technology: Effective within 1 hour of application.


Broad Spectrum: Effective against various weed species, including resistant weeds.


Flexible Application: Can be used early to late post-emergence.


Eco-Friendly: Low residue formulation with minimal environmental impact.


Enhanced Crop Tolerance: Contains isoxadifen safener for better crop safety.
